topics.title: Aretha Franklin: The Queen of Soul

hook.text: Aretha Franklin could sing the phone book and make you cry â€” her voice was pure emotion.

hook.text: Freddie Mercury could hold 72,000 people in the palm of his hand with just his voice.

quiz.question: What made Bohemian Rhapsody revolutionary?
options: It fused rock, opera, and ballad in a six-minute epic
It was the shortest song ever

hook.text: Frank Sinatra was the first modern pop star â€” teenage girls screamed and fainted at his shows.

quiz.question: What did Sinatra pioneer with albums like Songs for Swingin' Lovers?

topics.title: Whitney Houston: The Voice of a Generation

hook.text: Whitney Houston's voice was so powerful that engineers had to recalibrate equipment to record her.

quiz.question: How long did Whitney Houston's I Will Always Love You stay at number one?

topics.title: Bob Marley: Voice of the Oppressed

discovery.text: No Woman No Cry and One Love became anthems of hope for oppressed people everywhere.

punchline.text: He sang for peace in a world at war. The world is still listening.

quiz.question: What did Bob Marley do after an assassination attempt?
options: He played a peace concert uniting warring political factions
He moved to another country permanently

hook.text: Jimi Hendrix made the electric guitar do things its inventors never imagined possible.

quiz.question: How did Hendrix play guitar despite being left-handed?
options: He flipped a right-handed guitar upside down
He used a specially built guitar

topics.title: B.B. King: King of the Blues

climax.text: He performed over 15,000 concerts in his career â€” more than almost any musician in history.

quiz.question: Why did B.B. King name his guitar Lucille?
options: After a woman who caused a fire that nearly killed him at a show

hook.text: Chuck Berry invented the rock and roll guitar riff â€” and every guitarist since has borrowed from him.

hook.text: London graffiti in the 1960s read Clapton is God â€” written by fans who heard him play live.

quiz.question: How many times has Eric Clapton been inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame?

topics.title: Django Reinhardt: Jazz on Two Fingers

twist.text: He founded gypsy jazz â€” a genre that fuses Romani music with swing, still thriving today.

climax.text: His recordings from the 1930s sound as virtuosic as anything recorded since.

punchline.text: Most guitarists need ten fingers. He only needed two and a fire.

hook.text: Ray Charles blended gospel with blues when mixing them was considered a sin â€” and created soul music.

quiz.question: What genre did Ray Charles create by mixing gospel and blues?

hook.text: Elton John has sold over 300 million records â€” making him one of the best-selling artists ever.

quiz.question: What is the best-selling single of all time?

topics.title: Nina Simone: High Priestess of Soul

hook.text: Nina Simone wanted to be a classical pianist â€” racism redirected her into becoming a legend.

hook.text: Stevie Wonder signed with Motown at 11, went blind as an infant, and changed music by 25.

hook.text: Tori Amos played piano so intensely that she seemed to be wrestling with the instrument itself.

quiz.question: What organization did Tori Amos co-found?

hook.text: Phil Spector stacked so many instruments in the studio that the sound hit you like a wave.

quiz.question: What was Phil Spector's signature production technique?

hook.text: Brian Eno invented ambient music while lying in a hospital bed, too weak to adjust the volume.

climax.text: He proved that a non-musician with ideas could change music as profoundly as any virtuoso.

quiz.question: What genre did Brian Eno invent?

topics.title: Quincy Jones: The Man Behind the Music

hook.text: George Martin turned the Beatles from a good band into the greatest recording artists in history.

hook.text: Dr. Dre heard beats in his head that didn't exist yet â€” then built an empire from the sound.

topics.title: Lennon and McCartney: The Perfect Partnership

hook.text: Lennon and McCartney wrote 180 songs together â€” the most successful songwriting team in history.

quiz.question: How many songs did Lennon and McCartney write together?

hook.text: Joni Mitchell wrote songs so poetic that literature professors teach them alongside Shakespeare.

hook.text: Carole King wrote hit songs for other artists for a decade â€” then wrote the biggest album of the era.

hook.text: Prince played every instrument on his debut album at age 19 â€” and he played them all brilliantly.

topics.title: Michael Jackson: The King of Pop

hook.text: David Bowie changed identities like other artists change clothes â€” each persona defined an era.
